data.title: To Goyl (Goil?) Part 1/2
data.description:
You're probably wondering what I've been working on for the past few weeks.
This is it! A way for me to leave you lovey-dovey messages. That's really it, for now. Once you read a message, it gets archived in an advent-calendar-looking list at the bottom (numbered 1, 2, and so on). Once you open a message, you'll have to wait 24 hours for the next message to arrive.
So in 24 hours, you'll have a new message!
Edit: As of today (11/2/2022) you can star your favorite messages with the star button below!

data.title: To Goyl (Goil?) Part 2/2
data.description:
Messages won't open themselves, though, so if you don't visit the app for 10 days, you'll still only have one message to open (and not ten).
I have a few more features planned down the road, maybe adding a two-way feature so you can leave me 24 hour messages as well. Adding formatting like italics and bold, images, coupons (like "free hug" or "snap a selfie and send it to me") are also in the works.
I hope you enjoy some of the upcoming messages!

data.title: Did you know?
data.description: You're my favorite person in the whole world!

data.title: A Wise Quote from Winnie the Pooh
data.description: I think we dream so we don't have to be apart for so long. If we're in each other's dreams, we can be together all the time.

data.title: A life lived in love will never be dull
data.description:
I'm truly lucky to be able to share my life with you. The thought of you brightens my each and every day.
I hope you're reading this and smiling. I love you dearly.

data.title: Habitation, by Margaret Atwood
data.description:
Marriage is not
a house or even a tent
it is before that, and colder:

the edge of the forest, the edge
of the desert
    the unpainted stairs
at the back where we squat
outside, eating popcorn

the edge of the receding glacier

where painfully and with wonder
at having survived even
this far

we are learning to make fire

data.title: Sthandwa sami, by Yrsa Daley-Ward
data.description:
My thoughts about you are frightening but precise
I can see the house on the hill where we make our own vegetables out back
and drink warm wine out of jam jars
and sing songs in the kitchen until the sun comes up
when you make me feel like myself again.

data.title: The Quiet World, by Jeffrey McDaniel
data.description:
This one's kind of long, but it fits perfectly to how I feel about you. I hope you like it.

In an effort to get people to look
into each other's eyes more,
and also to appease the mutes,
the government has decided
to allot each person exactly one hundred
and sixty-seven words, per day.

When the phone rings, I put it to my ear
without saying hello. In the restaurant
I point at chicken noodle soup.
I am adjusting well to the new way.

Late at night, I call my long distance lover,
proudly say I only used fifty-nine today.
I saved the rest for you.

When she doesn't respond,
I know she's used up all her words,
so I slowly whisper I love you
thirty-two and a third times.
After that, we just sit on the line
and listen to each other breathe.

data.title: She Walks in Beauty, by Lord Byron
data.description:
She walks in beauty, like the night
Of cloudless climes and starry skies;
And all that's best of dark and bright
Meet in her aspect and her eyes

data.title: In One Another's Souls, by Remi
data.description:
The moment I heard my first love story
I started looking for you,
not knowing how useless that was.
Lovers don't meet somewhere along the way.
They're in one another's souls all along.

data.title: Stranger in a Strange Land, Robert A. Heinlein
data.description: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.

data.title: I want to hold you and watch the Office together
data.description: When you're lucky enough to meet your one person, then life takes a turn for the best. It can't get better than that. -John Krasinski

data.title: I love you because ______.
data.description: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves. -Victor Hugo

data.title: Things are never quite as scary when you‚Äôve got a best friend.
data.description: We are all a little weird and life‚Äôs a little weird, and when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall in mutual weirdness and call it love. -Dr. Seuss

data.title: If Not For You, by Joanna Fuchs
data.description:
If not for you, I wouldn't know
What true love really meant.
I'd never feel this inner peace;
I couldn't be content.

If not for you, I'd never have
The pleasures of romance.
I'd miss the bliss, the craziness,
Of love's sweet, silly dance.

I have to feel your tender touch;
I have to hear your voice;
No other one could take your place;
You're it; I have no choice.

If not for you, I'd be adrift;
I don't know what I'd do;
I'd be searching for my other half,
Incomplete, if not for you.

data.title: Living Together, by Ann Foster
data.description:
The small mouse crossed the floor,
fleet of foot, and fearful for her life.
She did not want to wake,
the farmer,
or his wife.
She simply wanted to feed,
her family, and go in peace.

The cheese was waiting on the wood platform.
The metal bar, also... waiting.

Now only steps away from fate,
the tiny creature realizes there are cookie crumbs,
left on the floor from the grandchildren's visit
late yesterday.
What a find, how kind...

The animal changes her path,
and gathers the leavings...
gratefully.
Then she turns and is gone.
No one, not even the cat,
noticed her passing.

The farmer's wife was only a little surprised,
when she woke up to find,
clean kitchen floors,
all the way up to the small
mouse door,
in the wall.

data.title: ‚ù§Ô∏è
data.description: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart. - Marcus Aurelius

data.title: Don't Quit
data.description:
When times are hard, you might stop for a bit,
But it's not over until the moment you quit.
On a river's bridge, failures are the planks;
Take one step at a time until you reach its banks. -Tarun Prasad

data.title: How Do I Love Thee, by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
data.description:
How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
I love thee to the depth and breadth and height
My soul can reach, when feeling out of sight
For the ends of being and ideal grace.
I love thee to the level of every day's
Most quiet need, by sun and candle-light.
I love thee freely, as men strive for right.
I love thee purely, as they turn from praise.
I love thee with the passion put to use
In my old griefs, and with my childhood's faith.
I love thee with a love I seemed to lose
With my lost saints. I love thee with the breath,
Smiles, tears, of all my life; and, if God choose,
I shall but love thee better after death.

data.title: Love So Amazing, by Elaine Chetty
data.description:
My love for you is like the raging sea,
So powerful and deep it will forever be.
Through storm, wind, and heavy rain,
It will withstand every pain.

data.title: Blazin
data.description:
You are blazing to me.
You are so blazing.
No, you are better than blazing:
you're blazin'.
No G
just an apostrophe.
You don't need a G,
cause i'm your G.
So we dropped the G,
and tonight you're gonna drop your G, String.
Let me see that crack girl,
I bet it aint whack girl.
Love,
your not so secret admirer-er

data.title: How Many Words Would It Take, by Amir Blumenfeld
data.description:
How many words would it take to accurately express what you mean to me?
How can you scientifically quantify how much lighter I become when you enter my day and how heavy I feel when you leave?
How can I describe how my smile just appears magnetically when I see your face?
How can I possibly count my thoughts of you when I think of you so constantly?
As thoughts within thoughts, within thoughts, within thoughts make it impossible to remember where one began and the other ended.
Time folds into itself as I am already nostalgic for our future and look forward to our past.
For the rest of my life, I love you.

data.title: Untitled, by Klaus Enser-Schlag
data.description:
Wie fern die Einsamkeit jetzt scheint
Wir sind in Liebe nun vereint
Das Gl√ºck hat mich zu Dir gef√ºhrt
ich liebe Dich ‚Äì und bin ger√ºhrt

data.title: Who would have guessed?
data.description: From the moment I met you, I liked you. From the moment I knew you, I loved you. Every day I get to spend with you is precious. I miss you, I love you. You're my everything.

data.title: A. A. Milne
data.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you."

data.title: TV Night
data.description:
I want to sit quietly with you
As the rain patters against wide windows
And the flickering light from the television illuminates the popcorn bag
I want to put my arm around you and sigh
Contentedly and cozily

data.title: Night
data.description:
It's late. I close out of my game
Taking off my headphones I hear a faint noise from the living room
Peeking through the crack of the doorframe, I see you snoring peacefully on the couch
"New Girl" quietly plays on the TV
Twin tails curl around you as a black cat yawns
apparently eager to display the depths of its mouth for all to see
Stringy white hair and a black nose protrude by your feet
from under the blanket

data.title: Bug
data.description:
Roses are red
Violets are blue
You are my bug
And I'm yours too

I love thee to the level of every day‚Äôs

data.title: Steadfast, by Amy Finley
data.description:
The miles are long and far and wide,
But my love for you will never subside.

My heart will continue strong and true,
Steadfast in my love for you.

You never need to fret or fear;
My only love is for you, my dear.

It hurts to be so far from you,
But a love like ours will make it through.

Keep holding on a little longer;
Our love will keep on growing stronger.

data.title: Can't wait to make you some tea you'll forget to drink üòÇ
Thoughts about you
data.description:
You make me so happy.
I really love spending time with you, even if it's just chatting on the phone.
When I think about it, I'm more comfortable with you than I am with anyone else.
I'm so glad I met you.
I'm so glad you're in my life.

A Quote About Love by Ann Landers
data.description: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.

data.title: Loving you from across the Ocean...
She Sights a Bird by Emily Dickinson
data.description:
She sights a Bird‚Äîshe chuckles‚Äî
She flattens‚Äîthen she crawls‚Äî
She runs without the look of feet‚Äî
Her eyes increase to Balls

data.title: I Got a Cat by Gabrielle Bell
data.description: Click here to read the whole thing

data.title: Come, and be my Baby, by Maya Angelou
data.description:
The highway is full of big cars
going nowhere fast
And folks is smoking anything that'll burn
Some people wrap their lies around a cocktail glass
And you sit wondering
where you're going to turn
I got it.
Come. And be my baby.

Some prophets say the world is gonna end tomorrow
But others say we've got a week or two
The paper is full of every kind of blooming horror
And you sit wondering
What you're gonna do.
I got it.
Come. And be my baby.

data.title: In our next lives, we're cats in lub
Zed and Brand used to do this XD
A Poem for my Darling Wife
data.description:
When we first met, I didn't know
All that goes on down below
Below your hair and skin and teeth
Far down below, deep underneath

Inside your head and in your heart
I now know more than at the start
That underneath your surface beauty
Is a brilliant, loving booty

data.title: I had OpenAI write a short story about Miffy and Henry
data.description:
Prompt: Write a short story about Miffy the bunny and Henry the bear having an adventure in the Mysterious Forest. At the end of their adventure, they realize there was nothing to be afraid of because they had each other.
Miffy the bunny and Henry the bear were the best of friends. They were always coming up with new adventures and looking for new places to explore.
One day, Miffy and Henry decided to go on a grand adventure to the Mysterious Forest. Neither of them had ever been there before and they were both a bit scared, but they were determined to brave their fears together.
They set off early in the morning, walking through the trees and feeling the cool breeze on their fur. As they ventured further and further into the forest, they noticed strange things happening around them. The leaves on the trees seemed to whisper secrets to one another and the birds they saw were unlike any they had ever seen before.
At first, they were a little scared, but then they heard something that sounded like laughter. Soon, they realized that it was coming from a group of friendly birds who were playing a game of tag. Miffy and Henry joined in the game and soon they were all laughing and having a grand time.
After they finished playing, Miffy and Henry continued on their way. As they ventured deeper into the forest, they began to feel less scared and more curious. They encountered all sorts of strange creatures and plants and eventually, they made it to the center of the forest.
When they arrived, they realized that there was nothing to be afraid of. All of the strange creatures and plants were harmless and they were surrounded by a feeling of peace and tranquility. They realized that the Mysterious Forest was actually home to many wonderful and beautiful things.
Miffy and Henry looked at each other and smiled. They had faced their fears and come out on top. Even though they were in a place full of unknowns, they knew that they had each other and that was all that mattered.
They hugged and laughed, knowing that their adventure had been a success. Together, they had conquered the Mysterious Forest.
